name: Travelodge London Farringdon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I paid £20 for my room through one of Travelodge's saver deals. Our room was 302 which was at the back overlooking the carpark. It was absolutely fine for the money I paid. Clean and basic, and most importantly, quiet!
reviews.title: Fine for a budget price

reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and I had a good nights sleep here. Coffee and tea facilities in the morning and a hot shower. Yes the furnishings were quite old, but I didn't expect a bran new room for the price I paid, all I wanted was a clean room, comfy bed and a good night's sleep. This ticked all my boxes. I'm unsure whether I would pay full price (£60-80) for the rooms here, but at sale price this was a good deal.
reviews.title: I suppose you get what you pay for...

reviews.text: One other thing - we used automatic check-in upon arrival. A machine looking a bit like an ATM takes your creditcard, or your reservation number and automatically checks you in and allocates you a room card. This probably took all of 30secs to do and was so easy to use! Saved having to wait and reception for someone and we zoomed straight up to our room.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: In the morning we gave our card in, brief check out questions with the receptionist and off we went. No problems here.
reviews.title: Cheap but not cheerful

reviews.text: £25 for a night in london...bargain! I would have preferred to pay more for a location closer to a tube station. Aside from the long walk to a tube, the room was grubby and very dated, lots of stains on the carpet, dirty bathroom...and very uncomfortable beds. We did not see one member of staff during our stay as check in and out were self service. It was a barhain.however be prepared!!!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I had a midweek one night stay due to a works Christmas party. The location was great for travelling to work next day, but the main road directly outside is busy all night, so though the beds were comfortable my sleep was disturbed. With three girls sharing it was a bargain at £23 each. The room was decent sized, the decor slightly worn but clean. The bathroom was slightly cramped, but adequately stocked, and the shower worked well. I've been in better decorated Travelodge's in quieter areas, but this was just the ticket with regards to location and budget.
reviews.title: Wallet friendly central London bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had separate Christmas parties in London so chose to stay in the City rather than have the hassle of travelling home. At £19.50 for the double room, this was a absolute steal. Even the guy at reception was shocked at the price (booked during one of the Travelodge promotional deals) as he said the walk-in price would be close to £200, which is frankly a joke (in my view). The room was clean, relatively spacious and had the benefit of small TV. For the price, there was nothing to fault.
reviews.title: It's a budget hotel chain so don't expect anything special.

reviews.text: If you pay up-to ca.£60-80 then this is a good option. Any more and you will start to feel that there were better options you could have chosen.
reviews.title: Perfectly reasonable option for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Travelodge offered the lowest priced room for central(ish) London for my trip last weekend.
reviews.title: This hotel does NOT deserve to be named Travelodge

reviews.text: It is indeed a budget hotel, and the facilities are basic. But at least it was clean, tea/coffee in the room etc. Staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Be realistic and you won't be disappointed

reviews.text: I always states that any review I give will be honest and factual. This is also the same. After reading previous reviews I was a little anxious as to what I should expect, many poor review, other asking for rooms at rear so they were quiet etc etc.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for - not half as bad as expected

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights. The hotel is a 5 min walk away from Kings Cross station past 2 other Travelodge hotels. On check in I asked ro a quiet roomm at the rear. I was given room 222 and when I located it I found it to be on the main road. The room was clean enough and whilst it is not 5 star I certainly did not pay 5 star prices. It had plenty of hot water, the TV was fine with Tea/Coffee facilities in the room. My small grip was that my "double" bed was 2 singles pushed together but no real problem. The staff were fine and attentive to my needs, Breakfast was Ok, nothing out of the ordinary but quite acceptable and guess what - the room was even quiet. I would stay here again if I had the same room rates so look logically and if you feel the price is right and you are not expecting 5 star than stay there, really its fine.
reviews.title: Good for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and included breakfast. Hotel is a 5 min walk from kings cross stations and is about 200 meters farther away from station than another travelodge hotel royal scott. Have now stayed at both royal scott and farringdon and i must say the farringdon is much better. The receptionist was very helpful and suggested a change of room for us. Most staff are a lttle layed back but it was acceptable. The breakfast was well worth having and the rooms adequate. Would consider staying again as a good price and being in kings cross is a Zone one area of London transport.
reviews.title: Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest!

reviews.text: I feel compelled to write a review of this hotel to counter some of the negative reviews that have come before. This is a Travelodge. In Central London. It cost me £59 on a flexible (cancellable) rate. You are not going to find a 4 star hotel at this price in this location. Ever. This hotel was perfect for what we needed: a place to crash after a Christmas party. We checked in on a Friday afternoon about half an hour before the official check-in time and at no extra cost. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were given Room 122 (first floor at the front of the building direclty opposite the lifts) which was clean. The bathroom was minuscule but I wasn't planning a night in with a relaxing bath so this wasn't a problem. We spent most of our time out so the room itself wasn't important. More important to me is the location; because of where the hotel is situated we were able to walk to and from everywhere we needed to get to including Clerkenwell, Russell Square, St Pancras and Euston. We were very late back so I don't know what night time noise was like but from about 8am I started to hear the lift noise and people talking outside the room but that's to be expected with a room directly opposite the lift. The traffic noise didn't bother me too much, neither did the slight rumbling from the tube. It's central London - what do you expect? I'm still utterly perplexed about why they only provide three pillows in a double room but you can ask for more if you need them!
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was dreading staying in this hotel after reading the reviews. I needn't have worried. It was clean, cheap, central and the staff were friendly. I wouldn't recommend it for more than a night or two and certainly not for a romantic trip away but if it's a bed for the night you need, you could do a lot worse.
reviews.title: Thank god I don't have to go back

reviews.text: Trevelodge: Basic. Clean. Comfy bed. Well served food and a pint in the bar on site.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: Had a ground floor room and could hear the tubes rumbling which wasn't a problem for a country bumpkin in the city but might annoy some people. Breakfast was average, nothing wrong with it, self service buffet including cooked breakfast. Staff friendly.
reviews.title: Can't even get basic room security right - twice!

reviews.text: Had a long weekend in London and Faringdon Travelodge was close to KX station and reasonably priced. Wasn't expecting The Ritz and can put up with tired decor and a bit of traffic noise, but do expect basic room security.
reviews.title: Spend a bit more and stay somewhere better

reviews.text: On check-in was given a key card to an already occupied room. I didn't steal anything and receptionist apologised.
reviews.title: Don't forget your earplugs and mattress

reviews.text: At midnight on Saturday night was woken by sound of someone trying the door handle and then an intruder walking in. He was lucky that he exited when I screamed at him and that i didn't have a weapon to hand or have a heart attack. Turned out to be a member of staff checking the room which they thought had already been vacated. What total incompetence.
reviews.title: Farringdon Travelodge London

description: Modern Hotel situated close to King's Cross Station & a short drive from West End, British Museum & other attractions.
